item.title: Bar graph
item.description: comparing frequencies height of bar =~ frequency

item.title: changing a variable
item.description: Used when we want to examen a new dataset that is based on a previous dataset Can be used to easily determine the average (by subtracting a value somewhat in the middle of the datapoints)

item.title: continuous variable
item.description: flow the value of the variable may be anything

item.title: Correlation coefficients
item.description: $$\text{correlation coefficient }r=\frac{\text{covariance of x and y}}{\sqrt{ (\text{variance of x}) }\sqrt{ (\text{variance of y}) }}$$ $r=+1$ → perfect positive correlation

item.title: Covariance
item.description: for [[bivariate distributions]] $$\text{sample covariance}=\frac{1}{n}S_{xy}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n(x-\bar{x})(y-\bar{y})$$

item.title: cumulative frequency
item.description: [!info] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: data classes
item.description: [[mode]]: Ø → [[modal class]] [[median]]: estimate middle class → midpoint [[mean]]: estimate middle value $\cdot$ frequency

item.title: discrete variable
item.description: step by step a variable may only hold a value at certain increments

item.title: First and third quartiles
item.description: the points below lies 25% and 75% of the data respectively [!info] Inter-quartile range distance between the first and third quartile

item.title: frequency
item.description: [!info] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: Graphs
item.description: [[Pie charts]] [[Bar graph]] [[Line graph]] [[Histogram]]

item.title: Histogram
item.description: distributing data into classes height of bar ~ frequency in classes [!important] Frequency polygon height of the bars connected → shows the trend that the data follows

item.title: Line graph
item.description: displaying tendencies height of points =~ frequency → connected

item.title: mean
item.description: Q: What is the mean of a dataset? the sum of the data dicided by the number of data points

item.title: Mean absolute deviation
item.description: $$\frac{\vert{x_1-\bar{x}}\vert+\vert{x_2-\bar{x}}\vert+…+\vert{x_n-\bar{x}}\vert}{n}$$

item.title: median
item.description: Q: What is the median of a dataset? the value(s) with the highest frequency

item.title: modal class
item.description: [!info] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: mode
item.description: Q: What is the mode of a dataset? the middle number when the data are in order $\tilde{x}$

item.title: mode, median, mean examples
item.description: Example 1 mode: 3,7 median: $$3,3,5,6,7,7,8,9$$ $$\tilde{x}=\frac{6+7}{2}=6.5$$ mean: 6 Example 2 value [[frequency]] 1 1 2 2 3 3 4 5 5 3 6 1 [[mode]]: 4

item.title: Percentiles
item.description: divide the range into 100 equal parts

item.title: Pie charts
item.description: comparing [[relative frequency]] angle at the center is proportional to the relative frequency

item.description: everyone has an equal chance of being selected

item.title: Range
item.description: the difference between its extreme values

item.title: Sample
item.description: a sample may be random or biased

item.title: Standard deviation
item.description: szórás $$\sigma=\sqrt{\frac{(x_1-\bar{x})^2+(x_2-\bar{x})^2+\ldots+(x_n-\bar{x})^2}{n}}$$

item.title: Statistics
item.description: the collection, analysis, representation and interpretation of data

item.title: Variance
item.description: szórás négyzet $$\sigma^2=\frac{(x_1-\bar{x})^2+(x_2-\bar{x})^2+\ldots+(x_n-\bar{x})^2}{n}$$ [!note] Shortened form $$\sigma ^2=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}(x_i-\bar{x})^2=$$ $$=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}(x_i^2-2x_i\bar{x}+\bar{x}^2)=$$ $$=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}x_i^2-\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}2x_i^2+\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\bar{x}^2=$$ $$=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}x_i^2-2\bar{x}\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}x_i+\bar{x}^2=$$ $$=\overline{x^2}-2\bar{x}\bar{x}+\bar{x}^2=$$ [!important] $$\sigma^2=\overline{x^2}-\bar{x}^2$$ var(x)
